\documentclass{article}

\usepackage[acronym]{glossaries}
 
\makeglossaries
 
\newglossaryentry{foo}{
  name=foo,
  description={Metasyntactic variable used as a placeholder often in conjunction
  with bar}
}
 
\newglossaryentry{bar}{
  name=bar,
  description={Metasyntactic variable used as a placeholder often in conjunction
  with foo}
}
 
\newacronym{gce}{GCE}{Gross Conceptual Error}
 
\begin{document}

Without \gls{foo} there is no \gls{bar} which often leads to a \acrshort{gce}.

\printglossary[type=\acronymtype]
\printglossary

\end{document}
